VPR.Q: What is the overall spatial distribution pattern shown in the heatmap?
VPR.A: The heatmap shows a {vertical gradient} pattern.

What is the heat value of the cell corresponding to Commercial and Affordability in the heatmap?

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.79}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.10}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Construction on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Construction on the x-axis is {0.73}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Mortgages on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Mortgages on the x-axis is {0.79}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Supply on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Supply on the y-axis is {0.75}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Commercial and Demand or the cell corresponding to Property Management and Supply?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Property Management} and {Supply} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Commercial and Condition or the cell corresponding to Industrial and Demand?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Industrial} and {Demand} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Residential and Age or the cell corresponding to Land and Supply?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Land} and {Supply} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Property Management and Age or the cell corresponding to Mortgages and Condition?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Mortgages} and {Condition} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.29 to 0.46?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Construction, Condition), (Development, Condition), (Industrial, Condition), (Land, Condition), (Mortgages, Condition), (Commercial, Demand), (Construction, Demand), (Development, Demand), (Industrial, Demand), (Land, Demand), (Mortgages, Demand), (Property Management, Demand), (Residential, Demand), (Commercial, Interest Rates), (Construction, Interest Rates), (Development, Interest Rates), (Property Management, Interest Rates)}.
